Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black with reserved dot in centre of bowl; exterior: reserved band around junction of bowl and foot; glazed streaky black (fired brown and worn) on foot; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros. The number 439 is written in pencil on the underside of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 439)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 41)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0959) (phase 2)
